title: 107_hr5536
content: The Act titled "ATM Public Safety and Crime Control Act" requires enhanced security measures at depository institutions. The Bank Protection Act of 1968 is amended to include enhanced surveillance requirements for depository institutions, based on recommendations from the FBI Director. This includes maintaining quality surveillance cameras for criminal prosecution purposes. The Bank Protection Act of 1968 is amended to include enhanced surveillance requirements for depository institutions, based on FBI Director recommendations. Insured credit unions must maintain quality surveillance cameras as per regulations. The Bank Protection Act of 1968 is amended to include requirements for surveillance cameras at depository institutions to produce quality evidence for criminal prosecutions. The Bank Protection Act of 1968 is amended to include requirements for surveillance cameras at depository institutions to produce quality evidence for criminal prosecutions. SEC. 3. STUDY AND TECHNICAL RECOMMENDATIONS BY FBI. The Bank Protection Act of 1968 is amended to include requirements for surveillance equipment at financial institutions to reduce crimes and facilitate prosecutions. The Director of the FBI will review security standards and consult with the Attorney General for effective crime prevention measures. The Director of the FBI will consult with the Attorney General to address security issues at financial institutions hindering prosecutions under criminal provisions. Recommendations for security standards will be made to federal banking agencies and the National Credit Union Administration Board. The Bank Protection Act of 1968 and section 205(e) of the Federal Credit Union Act require the Director of the FBI to submit security recommendations to the House and Senate Judiciary Committees, in addition to federal banking agencies and the National Credit Union Administration Board. A clerical amendment is made to the table of sections for chapter 33 of title 28, United States Code. SEC. 4. The Federal banking agencies and the National Credit Union Administration Board must finalize regulations within 6 months of receiving technical recommendations from the FBI Director. Depository institutions and credit unions must comply with these regulations within 6 months of publication in the Federal Register. SEC. 5. Amendments to definitions will be made. Amendments to definitions under the Bank Protection Act of 1968 include defining 'depository institution' and 'Federal supervisory agency' in alignment with the Federal Deposit Insurance Act.
